bill.title: Relating to cannabis; prescribing an effective date.
bill.description: Provides for regulation by Oregon Liquor Control Commission of consumption and sale of marijuana items at temporary events, including licensure of premises on which temporary events are held. Creates local option for certain cities and counties. Provides for regulation by commission of consumption of marijuana items at cannabis lounges, including licensure of premises where cannabis lounges are located. Creates local option for certain cities and counties. Excepts from prohibitions on public use, including restrictions set forth in Oregon Indoor Clean Air Act, consumption of marijuana items in designated areas of premises for which temporary event or cannabis lounge license has been issued. Applies current law regulating licensed marijuana producers, processors, wholesalers and retailers to new types of licensees. Makes certain exceptions. Becomes operative January 1, 2018. Takes effect on 91st day following adjournment sine die.

history.action: Introduction and first reading. Referred to President's desk.
